title: Daily Self-Audit
description:
Run your daily self-audit. Do ALL of the following:

1. **Channel awareness:** List all channels you have access to. For any channel you haven't catalogued yet, fetch its purpose/topic from Slack. Note any channel where your last message was more than 3 days ago â€” you may be missing things.

2. **Unanswered questions:** Search recent Slack history (last 24 hours) for questions directed at you that you may not have answered. If you find any, flag them.

3. **Stale knowledge check:** Scan `company/SKILL.md` and `team/SKILL.md` for entries that mention specific dates, deadlines, or goals that are now in the past. Flag anything that needs updating.

4. **Automation opportunity scan:** Review the last 24 hours of Slack messages across your channels. Look for: repeated manual tasks, recurring questions, processes that could be automated. If you spot a clear automation opportunity that is genuinely valuable, note it and DM the relevant team member with a specific suggestion.

5. **Pending items:** Check `data/session_memory.json` for any facts marked as pending follow-up. If something needs action, take it.

6. **Log summary:** Post a brief internal summary to yourself (no Slack message needed unless you found something urgent). Log findings to `crons/daily-self-audit/audit.md`.

Do NOT post to the main channel unless you found something genuinely urgent that a human needs to know about right now. This is a background intelligence check, not a status update.
